text: SECTION I:
label: BODY

text: Permitted Facilities
label: BODY

text: A. Plant Location
label: BODY

text: BMP is located in the Bull Mountains approximately 16 miles southeast of Roundup,
label: BODY

text: Montana, and approximately 35 miles northeast of Billings, Montana.  The legal
label: BODY

text: description of the site is Section 12, West ½ Section 13, and Section 14, Township 6 North,
label: BODY

text: Range 26 East, in Musselshell County, Montana.
label: BODY

text: B. Current Permit Action
label: BODY

text: On November 21, 2006, the Department of Environmental Quality (Department) received a
label: BODY

text: request from BMP for a modification to Permit #3179-01 to add, during the development
label: BODY

text: phase of the mining operation, a run-of-mine (ROM) coal stockpile, a topsoil stockpile,
label: BODY

text: additional haul roads, and associated transfers involved with the coal stockpile and topsoil
label: BODY

text: stockpile.  The request will allow BMP to transfer coal from the mine portal to a ROM coal
label: BODY

text: stockpile using haul trucks, a wheeled loader, and a bulldozer.  Coal will be dumped to the
label: BODY

text: ground from the mine portal.  A wheeled loader will load the haul trucks for transport to the
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile.  The haul trucks will dump the coal to the ground and a bulldozer will
label: BODY

text: move the coal to the desired location within the pile.  Prior to stockpiling the coal, a
label: BODY

text: bulldozer will prepare the coal stockpile site by removing the topsoil (about 12 inches of
label: BODY

text: soil depth) and move the soil into a pile for storage.
label: BODY

text: BMP proposed the following equipment and emission sources as listed below:
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile (surface area: 520,000 square feet, (ft2))
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile site preparation (topsoil removal – dozer)
label: BODY

text: Topsoil storage pile (surface area: 100,000 ft2)
label: BODY

text: Mobile sources (haul trucks, wheeled loader, and bulldozer)
label: BODY

text: BMP will add to the ROM coal stockpile until the primary phase of the mining operation
label: BODY

text: begins.  After the primary phase of the mining operation has begun, BMP will transfer the
label: BODY

text: coal from the coal stockpile to the new coal preparation plant.  BMP is not requesting an
label: BODY

text: increase in the production rate of the development phase.  Once the primary phase has
label: BODY

text: begun, the haul trucks, wheeled loader, and the requested haul road operations will not be
label: BODY

text: needed.

text: C. Operational Reporting Requirements

label: BODY

text: points, as required by the Department in the annual emission inventory request.  The
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: emission inventory contained in the permit analysis.

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: compliance with permit limitations (ARM 17.8.505).

text: D. Ambient Monitoring Requirements
label: BODY

text: Modeled impacts predicted the BMP project would consume 94% (141 µg/m3) of the 24-
label: BODY

text: hour ambient standard (150µg/m3) and 87% (43.5 µg/m3) of the annual standard (50
label: BODY

text: µg/m3).  Based on this information and using the Department Ambient Monitoring
label: BODY

text: Requirements Guidance Statement (10/09/98), the Department, assuming a medium level
label: BODY

text: of confidence, will require ambient monitoring for the mine operations as proposed by
label: BODY

text: BMP when the mine reaches a coal production level of 1.3 million tons during any rolling
label: BODY

text: 12-month period.
label: BODY

text: BMP shall operate an ambient air quality monitoring network around the project area.  The
label: BODY

text: monitoring requirements are more fully described in the Monitoring Plan (Attachment 1).
label: BODY

text: Exact monitoring locations must be approved by the Department prior to installation or
label: BODY

text: relocation (ARM 17.8.749).
label: BODY

text: E. Notification
label: BODY

text: BMP shall provide the Department with written notification of the following dates within
label: BODY

text: the specified time periods (ARM 17.8.749):
label: BODY

text: 1. Once the coal production for the development phase of the coal mining operation
label: BODY

text: reaches 1.3 million tons during any rolling 12-month time period within 15 days after
label: BODY

text: coal production reaches 1.3 million tons during any rolling 12-month time period;
label: BODY

text: 2. Commencement of construction of the primary phase of the coal mine within 30 days
label: BODY

text: after commencement of construction; and
label: BODY

text: 3. Actual start-up date of the primary phase of the coal mine within 15 days after the
label: BODY

text: actual start-up of the coal mine in the primary phase.

text: SECTION III: General Conditions
label: BODY

text: A. Inspection – BMP shall allow the Department’s representatives access to the source at all
label: BODY

text: reasonable times for the purpose of making inspections or surveys, collecting samples,
label: BODY

text: obtaining data, auditing any monitoring equipment or observing any monitoring or testing,
label: BODY

text: and otherwise conducting all necessary functions related to this permit.
label: BODY

text: B. Waiver – The permit and the terms, conditions, and matters stated herein shall be deemed
label: BODY

text: accepted if BMP fails to appeal as indicated below.
label: BODY

text: C. Compliance with Statutes and Regulations – Nothing in this permit shall be construed as
label: BODY

text: relieving BMP of the responsibility for complying with any applicable federal or Montana
label: BODY

text: statute, rule or standard, except as specifically provided in ARM 17.8.740, et seq. (ARM
label: BODY

text: D. Enforcement – Violations of limitations, conditions and requirements contained herein may
label: BODY

text: constitute grounds for permit revocation, penalties or other enforcement action as specified
label: BODY

text: in Section 75-2-401, et seq., MCA.
label: BODY

text: Appeals – Any person or persons jointly or severally adversely affected by the
label: BODY

text: Department's decision may request, within 15 days after the Department renders its
label: BODY

text: decision, upon affidavit setting forth the grounds therefore, a hearing before the Board of
label: BODY

text: Environmental Review (Board).  A hearing shall be held under the provisions of the
label: BODY

text: Montana Administrative Procedures Act.  The filing of a request for a hearing does not
label: BODY

text: stay the Department’s decision, unless the Board issues a stay upon receipt of a petition
label: BODY

text: and a finding that a stay is appropriate under Section 75-2-211(11)(b), MCA.  The issuance
label: BODY

text: of a stay on a permit by the Board postpones the effective date of the Department’s
label: BODY

text: decision until conclusion of the hearing and issuance of a final decision by the Board.  If a
label: BODY

text: stay is not issued by the Board, the Department’s decision on the application is final 16
label: BODY

text: days after the Department’s decision is made.
label: BODY

text: Permit Inspection – As required by ARM 17.8.755, Inspection of Permit, a copy of the air
label: BODY

text: quality permit shall be made available for inspection by the Department at the location of
label: BODY

text: the source.

text: Introduction/Process Description
label: BODY

text: Permitted Equipment
label: BODY

text: BMP Investments Incorporated (BMP) operates an underground coal mining operation in
label: BODY

text: the Bull Mountains near Roundup, Montana and approximately 35 miles north of
label: BODY

text: Billings, Montana.  The facility contains reject piles, clean coal piles, an old coal
label: BODY

text: preparation plant, a new coal preparation plant, a rail loadout, a waste disposal area
label: BODY

text: (WDA), mine ventilation, mine yard area equipment, a quarry, a run-of-mine (ROM) coal
label: BODY

text: stockpile, a topsoil storage pile, and various conveyors and transfer stations.
label: BODY

text: Source Description
label: BODY

text: BMP operates an underground coal mine that is initially capable of producing up to 1.3
label: BODY

text: million tons of raw coal per year.  The initial phase of this project covers the
label: BODY

text: development stage of the operation.  The initial development phase allows for some
label: BODY

text: production while the ultimate primary facilities are constructed.  The primary facilities
label: BODY

text: (new coal wash plant and on-site rail loadout) will support a production rate of up to 4.0
label: BODY

text: million tons of raw coal per year.
label: BODY

text: The operations at the facility can be classified into four categories: underground mining,
label: BODY

text: coal handling and storage, coal cleaning, and waste disposal.  Coal will be mined
label: BODY

text: underground using continuous miner sections and longwall panels.  The continuous miner
label: BODY

text: will be used to establish a mineable block of coal, and the longwall equipment will be
label: BODY

text: used to extract the block of coal.  A conveyor belt will be used to transfer the ROM coal
label: BODY

text: to a stockpile outside of the mine portal.
label: BODY

text: Surface material storage facilities will include stockpiles of ROM coal, clean coal, and
label: BODY

text: reject material from the wash plant.  Material will be moved from inside the mine to the
label: BODY

text: ROM stockpile on a high capacity belt conveyor.  Other conveyors will be used to
label: BODY

text: transport coal from the ROM pile to the coal cleaning facility and from there to the clean
label: BODY

text: coal piles.  Coal will be supplied to local consumers from bins with hoppers located at the
label: BODY

text: wash plant facilities.  Reject material will be sent to the WDA.
label: BODY

text: During the development operations, the coal will be transferred from the ROM stockpile
label: BODY

text: to the existing wash plant via a belt conveyor.  The coal will pass through the buffer bin
label: BODY

text: to a crusher and sizing screen and then on to the heavy media washer.  The final product
label: BODY

text: will be passed through a fluidized bed to air dry the product.  A primary coal washing
label: BODY

text: facility will be constructed concurrently with the development operations.
label: BODY

text: The development phase wash plant will reject 19 percent of the raw coal stream and the
label: BODY

text: new primary facility will reject 13 percent of the raw coal stream.  These coal processing
label: BODY

text: wastes and other mine development wastes will be permanently disposed of in the WDA
label: BODY

text: located 1.4 miles northeast of the wash plant.  The mine plan calls for revegetation of this
label: BODY

text: area after completion of the project and after the appropriate seed bed preparation.
label: BODY

text: Permit History
label: BODY

text: Permit #3179-00 was issued to BMP on May 10, 2002, for the project as described
label: BODY

text: above located in Sections 12, 13, and 14, Township 6 North, Range 26 East, in
label: BODY

text: Musselshell County, Montana.
label: BODY

text: On May 9, 2003, BMP submitted a request to delay the commencement of ambient air
label: BODY

text: monitoring until the mine reaches a coal production level of 1.3 million tons during any
label: BODY

text: rolling 12-month period.  The permit action was an administrative amendment to make
label: BODY

text: that change and to update the rule citations in the permit.  Permit #3179-01 replaced
label: BODY

text: Permit #3179-00.
label: BODY

text: Current Permit Action
label: BODY

text: On November 21, 2006, the Department of Environmental Quality (Department) received
label: BODY

text: a request from BMP for a modification to Permit #3179-01 to add, during the
label: BODY

text: development phase of the mining operation, a ROM coal stockpile, a topsoil stockpile,
label: BODY

text: additional haul roads, and associated transfers involved with the coal stockpile and
label: BODY

text: topsoil stockpile.  The request will allow BMP to transfer coal from the mine portal to a
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile using haul trucks, a wheeled loader, and a bulldozer.  Coal will be
label: BODY

text: dumped to the ground from the mine portal.  A wheeled loader will load the haul trucks
label: BODY

text: for transport to the ROM coal stockpile.  The haul trucks will dump the coal to the
label: BODY

text: ground and a bulldozer will move the coal to the desired location within the pile.  Prior to
label: BODY

text: stockpiling the coal, a bulldozer will prepare the coal stockpile site by removing the
label: BODY

text: topsoil (about 12 inches of soil depth) and move the soil into a pile for storage.
label: BODY

text: BMP proposed the following equipment and emission sources as listed below:
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile (surface area: 520,000 square feet, (ft2))
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile site preparation (topsoil removal – dozer)
label: BODY

text: Topsoil storage pile (surface area: 100,000 ft2)
label: BODY

text: Mobile sources (haul trucks, wheeled loader, and bulldozer)
label: BODY

text: BMP will add to the ROM coal stockpile until the primary phase of the mining operation
label: BODY

text: begins.  After the primary phase of the mining operation has begun, BMP will transfer
label: BODY

text: the coal from the coal stockpile to the new coal preparation plant.  BMP is not requesting
label: BODY

text: an increase in the production rate of the development phase.  Once the primary phase has
label: BODY

text: begun, the haul trucks, wheeled loader, and the requested haul road operations will not be
label: BODY

text: needed.   Permit #3179-02 replaces Permit #3179-01.
label: BODY

text: ARM 17.8, Subchapter 3 – Emission Standards, including, but not limited to:
label: BODY

text: 1. ARM 17.8.304 Visible Air Contaminants.  This rule requires that no person may
label: BODY

text: cause or authorize emissions to be discharged into the outdoor atmosphere from any
label: BODY

text: source installed after November 23, 1968, that exhibit an opacity of 20% or greater
label: BODY

text: averaged over six consecutive minutes.
label: BODY

text: 2. ARM 17.8.308 Particulate Matter, Airborne.  (1) This rule requires an opacity
label: BODY

text: limitation of 20% for all fugitive emission sources and that reasonable precautions be
label: BODY

text: taken to control emissions of airborne Particulate Matter (PM).  (2) Under this rule,
label: BODY

text: BMP shall not cause or authorize the use of any street, road or parking lot without
label: BODY

text: taking reasonable precautions to control emissions of airborne particulate matter.
label: BODY

text: 3. ARM 17.8.309 Particulate Matter, Fuel Burning Equipment.  This rule requires that
label: BODY

text: no person shall cause, allow or permit to be discharged into the atmosphere
label: BODY

text: particulate matter caused by the combustion of fuel in excess of the amount
label: BODY

text: determined by this rule.
label: BODY

text: 4. ARM 17.8.310 Particulate Matter, Industrial Process.  This rule requires that no
label: BODY

text: person shall cause, allow or permit to be discharged into the atmosphere particulate
label: BODY

text: matter in excess of the amount set forth in this rule.
label: BODY

text: 5. ARM 17.8.322 Sulfur Oxide Emissions--Sulfur in Fuel.  This rule requires that no
label: BODY

text: person shall burn liquid, solid or gaseous fuel in excess of the amount set forth in this
label: BODY

text: rule.

text: 6. ARM 17.8.340 Standard of Performance for New Stationary Sources and Emission
label: BODY

text: Guidelines for Existing Sources.  This rule incorporates, by reference, 40 CFR 60,
label: BODY

text: Standards of Performance for New Stationary Sources (NSPS).  BMP is considered
label: BODY

text: an NSPS affected facility under 40 CFR 60 and is subject to the requirements of 40
label: BODY

text: CFR 60, Subpart Y, Standard of Performance for Coal Preparation Plants.
label: BODY

text: Subpart Y - Coal Preparation Plants - requires a particulate emission limitation of
label: BODY

text: 0.04 grams per dry standard cubic meter, a 10 percent opacity limitation on
label: BODY

text: pneumatic coal cleaning emissions, and an opacity limitation of 20 percent for coal
label: BODY

text: processing, conveying, storage, and loading systems as described in Section II of the
label: BODY

text: permit.  The subpart also requires particulate and opacity limitations for thermal
label: BODY

text: dryers.  The coal dryer proposed for the development phase of the operation uses
label: BODY

text: ambient air as opposed to a heated gas stream; therefore, that portion of the
label: BODY

text: regulation is not applicable.  If at some point, the permittee proposes to use a heated
label: BODY

text: gas stream for coal drying, the Department must be notified in order to determine the
label: BODY

text: monitoring and testing requirements with respect to NSPS applicability.  The NSPS
label: BODY

text: applicability for pneumatic coal cleaning and thermal dryers is specific to bituminous
label: BODY

text: coal, while the other provisions apply to all classifications of coal.  The applicant
label: BODY

text: reported that the coal to be mined is classified as bituminous.

text: III.
label: BODY

text: BACT Determination
label: BODY

text: A BACT determination is required for each new or altered source.  BMP shall install on the new
label: BODY

text: or altered source the maximum air pollution control capability, which is technically practicable
label: BODY

text: and economically feasible, except that BACT shall be utilized.  The current permit action
label: BODY

text: modifies Permit #3179-01 by allowing a ROM coal stockpile to operate during the development
label: BODY

text: phase of the mining operation and also adds an emission source to the facility (topsoil storage
label: BODY

text: pile); therefore, a BACT analysis was required for the current permit action.
label: BODY

text: The Department determined that BACT for the ROM coal stockpile, a topsoil storage pile,
label: BODY

text: transfer points, coal handling, topsoil handling, and vehicle traffic on unpaved roads is the
label: BODY

text: continuation of emission control techniques currently used at the mine.  This includes chemical
label: BODY

text: stabilization and watering on haul roads and good engineering practices such as minimizing fall
label: BODY

text: distances on material handling operations as necessary to maintain compliance with the opacity
label: BODY

text: and reasonable precautions limitations.
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: In general, fugitive emissions from open sources are controlled by preventative and/or mitigating
label: BODY

text: measures/techniques.  The sources of fugitive particulates may be classified according to the
label: BODY

text: activities, which generate the emissions.  The activity classes for the proposed project include: 1)
label: BODY

text: wind erosion of coal stockpile, 2) coal handling and transfer, 3) wind erosion of topsoil storage
label: BODY

text: pile, 4) topsoil handling, and 5) travel on unpaved roads.
label: BODY

text: Wind erosion affects both the storage piles and outdoor material handling/disposal activities.
label: BODY

text: Preventative techniques reduce emissions by reducing the extent of the source, by modifying the
label: BODY

text: process, or by adjusting work practices.  Reduction of emissions of fugitive dust or particulate
label: BODY

text: matter from wind erosion and material handling can be accomplished by enclosure, chemical
label: BODY

text: stabilization, or material wetting.  Chemical stabilization will not be considered because it has
label: BODY

text: been deemed technically unfeasible for the proposed project due to the constant activity on the
label: BODY

text: storage piles and because the chemicals used could become air pollutants as the coal is burned.
label: BODY

text: A significant concern with this operation is the potential for wind erosion from the ROM and
label: BODY

text: clean coal stockpiles.  Enclosure of the stockpiles (in barns or silos) was considered through the
label: BODY

text: BACT analysis but was not determined to be technically feasible due to the constant material
label: BODY

text: movement at the source and this type of control has not been required for recently permitted
label: BODY

text: similar sources of particulate emissions.  The Department will require that BMP apply surface
label: BODY

text: moisture to the product either during mining activities, washing, or loadout operations and utilize
label: BODY

text: contouring techniques to reduce potential for wind erosion.
label: BODY

text: The Department determined that the use of reasonable precautions, contouring, and watering, as
label: BODY

text: necessary, to maintain compliance with the 20% opacity limitation will constitute BACT for the
label: BODY

text: coal stockpiles.
label: BODY

text: The Department determined that the use of reasonable precautions, contouring, watering and/or
label: BODY

text: chemical dust suppressant, compaction techniques, and re-vegetation, as necessary, to maintain
label: BODY

text: compliance with the 20% opacity limitation will constitute BACT for the topsoil storage pile.
label: BODY

text: Material handling for the purposes of this BACT analysis is broken down into two categories,
label: BODY

text: coal product and topsoil product.  Coal handling activities include drops to and from the front-end
label: BODY

text: loader, haul trucks, and ground.  Coal handling also includes movement of the pile by a bulldozer.
label: BODY

text: Topsoil handling occurs by moving the topsoil into a storage pile by a bulldozer.
label: BODY

text: The Department determined that BMP shall minimize the fall distance associated with all
label: BODY

text: material handling activities to the greatest extent that is practically feasible.  Further, BMP shall
label: BODY

text: develop, implement, and maintain good housekeeping practices to keep coal and topsoil transfer
label: BODY

text: locations clean.
label: BODY

text: For particulates generated during loadout operations onto stockpiles, the Department determined
label: BODY

text: that the use of fixed stackers with an underground reclaim system at the permanent facility and a
label: BODY

text: radial stacker with an adjustable chute at the development facility constitutes BACT.
label: BODY

text: In addition, BMP shall utilize water and/or chemical dust suppressant, as necessary, for the
label: BODY

text: purpose of controlling emissions from the movement of materials by bulldozer or front-end
label: BODY

text: loader.  Also, BMP shall use watering and/or chemical dust suppressants, contouring techniques,
label: BODY

text: and eventually soil covering and re-vegetation for controlling particulate emissions from the
label: BODY

text: topsoil storage pile.
label: BODY

text: Further, BMP must take reasonable precautions to limit the fugitive emissions of airborne
label: BODY

text: particulate matter on haul roads.  BMP shall clean up all spilled material from roadways to further
label: BODY

text: limit potential fugitive emissions.  The Department determined that the use water spray and/or
label: BODY

text: chemical dust suppressant, as necessary, to maintain compliance with the opacity and reasonable
label: BODY

text: precautions limitations will constitute BACT for the haul roads.
label: BODY

text: In summary, the Department determined that good housekeeping practices, minimization of fall
label: BODY

text: distance for material transfer operations, the application of moisture throughout the mining
label: BODY

text: process, using stackers with a reclaim system for the primary phase of operations and a radial
label: BODY

text: stacker with an adjustable chute for the development phase for pile forming, enclosures for all
label: BODY

text: surface conveyors and conveyor transfer points incorporating fabric filter baghouses or pick-up
label: BODY

text: points, and water spray and/or chemical dust suppressant, as necessary, to maintain compliance
label: BODY

text: with permitted opacity requirements and reasonable precautions limitations constitutes BACT for
label: BODY

text: these sources.
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: VI.
label: BODY

text: Ambient Air Impact Analysis
label: BODY

text: Project Summary
label: BODY

text: The current permit action is to add, during the development phase of the mining operation, a
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile, a topsoil stockpile, additional haul roads, and associated transfers involved
label: BODY

text: with the coal stockpile and topsoil stockpile.
label: BODY

text: The mine project will include two phases: the development phase and the primary phase.  During
label: BODY

text: the development phase of the operation, BMP proposes to initially mine at a rate of 1.3 million
label: BODY

text: tons of raw coal per year.  The initial development phase will allow for some production while
label: BODY

text: the primary phase facilities are constructed.  These primary facilities include a new coal wash
label: BODY

text: plant and an onsite rail loadout, which will support production of up to 4 million tons of coal per
label: BODY

text: year.
label: BODY

text: Review of Modeling Analysis
label: BODY

text: Air dispersion modeling was not required for the current permitting action.  However,
label: BODY

text: GeoResearch Inc. performed an air quality impact analysis for this project for the initial
label: BODY

text: application submitted by Meridian Minerals Company on January 16, 1991, and GeoResearch
label: BODY

text: performed a second analysis for the Addendum dated February 25, 1992, that was submitted to
label: BODY

text: the Department on March 5, 1992.  The analysis used the EPA Industrial Source Complex Model
label: BODY

text: (ISCST and ISCLT) to estimate the impacts of the particulates, NOX, SO2, and CO.  The analysis
label: BODY

text: included both the development phase and the primary phase, which originally included the ROM
label: BODY

text: coal stockpile.  The 1992 results showed that predicted ambient impacts for this facility would not
label: BODY

text: cause or contribute to a violation of any state or federal air quality standard.
label: BODY

text: The following comments have been prepared by the Department.

text: Terrestrial and Aquatic Life and Habitats;
label: BODY

text: Water Quality, Quantity, and Distribution;
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Overall impacts to the physical and biological environmental parameters noted above would be
label: BODY

text: minor because the activities would occur within the current mining area with little or no
label: BODY

text: additional surface disturbance.  Furthermore, the current permit action would allow operation of a
label: BODY

text: ROM coal stockpile, during the development phase of the mining operation, within the currently
label: BODY

text: approved mine plan area.  This would result in a relatively small increase in air pollutant
label: BODY

text: emissions above those associated with the current mining rate.  In the maximum emission
label: BODY

text: scenario, there would be a particulate emission increase of less than 10 percent above the current
label: BODY

text: permitted level.  All of the increase would be fugitive emissions.  There would be a small
label: BODY

text: increase in air pollutant deposition in the area and in the use of water for dust suppression.
label: BODY

text: Overall, the demands and impacts to terrestrial and aquatic life and habitats; water quality,
label: BODY

text: quantity, and distribution; geology and soil quality, stability, and moisture; vegetation cover,
label: BODY

text: quantity, and quality; and aesthetics related to the increased activities would be minor.
label: BODY

text: Air Quality
label: BODY

text: The air quality impacts from the increased activities would be minor because Permit #3179-02
label: BODY

text: would include conditions limiting the visible emissions (opacity) from the plant operations, and
label: BODY

text: would require water and/or chemical dust suppressant and other means to control air pollution.
label: BODY

text: The plant operations would continue to be limited by Permit #3179-02 to total emissions of 250
label: BODY

text: tons per year or less from non-fugitive sources, including any additional equipment used at the
label: BODY

text: site.  This facility would continue to be considered a minor source of air pollution for the Title V
label: BODY

text: program, because the facility’s potential emissions would be below 100 tons per year.  Overall,
label: BODY

text: air emissions from the increased activities would have minor impacts on air quality in the
label: BODY

text: immediate and surrounding area because of the relatively small amount of additional pollutants
label: BODY

text: generated.  Air pollution controls currently used at the facility, such as fabric filtration, chemical
label: BODY

text: stabilization and/or water suppression, would reduce air emissions from equipment operations,
label: BODY

text: storage piles, and haul roads.
label: BODY

text: Unique Endangered, Fragile, or Limited Environmental Resources
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would occur within the previously disturbed industrial site at the mine.
label: BODY

text: As part of the MEPA analysis on initial mine development, assessments of potential impacts to
label: BODY

text: unique endangered, fragile, or limited environmental resources were done by the Department,
label: BODY

text: including contact with the Montana Natural Heritage Program – Natural Resource Information
label: BODY

text: System (NRIS) to identify species of special concern at the mine site.  The likelihood that the
label: BODY

text: operation of the ROM coal stockpile during the development phase of the mining operation
label: BODY

text: would impact unique endangered, fragile, or limited environmental resources would be minor
label: BODY

text: because of the relatively small increase in emissions, the lack of change to the mine plan area,
label: BODY

text: and the conditions placed in Permit #3179-02.
label: BODY

text: Demands on Environmental Resources of Water, Air, and Energy
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would require minimal additional amounts of water, air, and energy.
label: BODY

text: Limited amounts of water would be required to be used for dust control for the equipment,
label: BODY

text: product stockpiles, and surrounding haul roads.  Further, as described in Section 7.F. of this EA,
label: BODY

text: pollutant emissions generated from the operation would have minimal impacts on air quality in
label: BODY

text: the immediate and surrounding area because of the relatively small increase in emissions, the lack
label: BODY

text: of change to the mine plan area, and the conditions placed in Permit #3179-02.  Overall, the
label: BODY

text: demands and impacts to the environmental resource of water, air, and energy related to the
label: BODY

text: increased activities would be minor.
label: BODY

text: Historical and Archaeological Sites
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would occur within the previously disturbed industrial site at the mine.
label: BODY

text: According to past correspondence from the Montana State Historic Preservation Office, there is
label: BODY

text: low likelihood of adverse disturbance to any known archaeological or historic site because of
label: BODY

text: previous industrial disturbance within the area.  Therefore, the likelihood that the increased
label: BODY

text: activities would have an impact on historical or archaeological sites would be minor.
label: BODY

text: Cumulative and Secondary Impacts
label: BODY

text: The increased activities from the project would cause minor cumulative and secondary impacts to
label: BODY

text: the physical and biological aspects of the human environment.  There would be a relatively small
label: BODY

text: increase in air emissions of particulate matter and PM10 and no increase in the mine plan area.

text: SUMMARY OF COMMENTS ON POTENTIAL ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL EFFECTS:
label: HH3

text: The following comments have been prepared by the Department.
label: BODY

text: Social Structures and Mores
label: BODY

text: Cultural Uniqueness and Diversity
label: BODY

text: The Department determined that the current permit action would not have an impact on the social
label: BODY

text: structures and mores or the cultural uniqueness and diversity of this area of operation because the
label: BODY

text: operation of a ROM coal stockpile, during the development phase of the mining operation, is
label: BODY

text: relatively minor and the activities would occur within the previously disturbed industrial area.
label: BODY

text: The surrounding area would remain unchanged as a result of the proposed project.
label: BODY

text: Local and State Tax Base and Tax Revenue
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would have little or no impact on the local and state tax base and tax
label: BODY

text: revenue.  No full time, permanent employees would be added as a result of issuing Permit #3179-
label: BODY

text: 02.  The increase in the amount of equipment at the site would be minimal.
label: BODY

text: Agricultural or Industrial Production
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would occur within the previously disturbed industrial area; therefore, the
label: BODY

text: Department would not expect an impact to or displacement of agricultural production.  The
label: BODY

text: increased activities would be relatively small compared to the existing mining operation and
label: BODY

text: would have only a minor impact on local industrial production.  In addition, the facility would
label: BODY

text: operate within the permitted mining area, which upon completion of mining operations, would be
label: BODY

text: reclaimed, as specified, by the Environmental Management Bureau (EMB) of the Department.
label: BODY

text: Minor and temporary effects may occur to agricultural land, and the EMB would be responsible
label: BODY

text: for oversight of any reclamation activities.  Therefore, impacts to agricultural or industrial
label: BODY

text: production would be minor.
label: BODY

text: Human Health
label: BODY

text: Permit #3179-02 would incorporate conditions to ensure that the increased activities would be
label: BODY

text: accomplished in compliance with all applicable air quality rules and standards.  These rules and
label: BODY

text: standards are designed to be protective of human health.  As noted in Section 7.F. of this EA, the
label: BODY

text: air emissions from this facility would be minimized by fabric filtration, water spray and/or
label: BODY

text: chemical stabilization, and opacity limitations.  Furthermore, the increased activities and resulting
label: BODY

text: air emissions would be relatively small.  Therefore, any associated impacts to human health
label: BODY

text: would be minor based as a result of compliance with the applicable standards and operational
label: BODY

text: conditions and limitations incorporated within the permit.
label: BODY

text: Access to and Quality of Recreational and Wilderness Activities
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would occur within the previously disturbed industrial property and
label: BODY

text: would not impact access to recreational and wilderness activities.  Minor impacts on the quality
label: BODY

text: of recreational activities could be created from the noise from the increased activities; however,
label: BODY

text: these would be small in comparison to existing activities.  Emissions from the operation would be
label: BODY

text: minimized as a result of the conditions that would be placed in Permit #3179-02.  Therefore, the
label: BODY

text: associated impacts on the access to and quality of recreational and wilderness activities would be
label: BODY

text: minor.
label: BODY

text: Quantity and Distribution of Employment; and
label: BODY

text: Distribution of Population
label: BODY

text: As a result of the relatively small size of the operations associated with the increased activities,
label: BODY

text: the quantity and distribution of employment and the distribution of population in the area would
label: BODY

text: not be impacted.  No full time, permanent employees would be added as a result of issuing Permit
label: BODY

text: #3179-02 and no related secondary employment would be expected.  Therefore, no impacts to the
label: BODY

text: distribution of population in the area would be expected.
label: BODY

text: Demands of Government Services
label: BODY

text: Minor increases may be observed in the local traffic on existing roads in the area.  Very limited
label: BODY

text: additional government services would be required relative to these operations.  Overall, demands
label: BODY

text: for government services would be minor.
label: BODY

text: Industrial and Commercial Activity
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would represent only a minor increase in the industrial activity in the area
label: BODY

text: because the operation of the ROM coal stockpile would operate during the development phase of
label: BODY

text: the mining operation.  No additional commercial activity would result because no secondary
label: BODY

text: activities are expected to move to the area as a result of the increased activities.  Overall, only a
label: BODY

text: minor increase in industrial and commercial activity would be expected as a result of the
label: BODY

text: proposed project.
label: BODY

text: Locally Adopted Environmental Plans and Goals
label: HH2

text: The Department is not aware of any locally adopted environmental plans or goals that would be
label: BODY

text: affected by the proposed project.  The state standards would protect the proposed site and the
label: BODY

text: environment surrounding the site.
label: BODY

text: Cumulative and Secondary Impacts
label: BODY

text: The increased activities would cause minor cumulative and secondary impacts to the social and
label: BODY

text: economic aspects of the human environment in the immediate area because of the small increase
label: BODY

text: in potential air emissions.  Increases in traffic would have minor impacts on the local traffic in the
label: BODY

text: immediate area.  Because the project would be a relatively small increase of particulate emissions
label: BODY

text: compared to the current operation, only minor economic impacts to the local economy would be
label: BODY

text: expected.  New businesses would not be drawn to any areas and permanent jobs would not be
label: BODY

text: created or lost as a result of the proposed project.  Overall, the proposed project would have
label: BODY

text: minor impacts to the cumulative and secondary impacts to the social and economic aspects of the
label: BODY

text: human environment.
label: BODY

text: Recommendation:  An Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) is not required.
label: BODY

text: If an EIS is not required, explain why the EA is an appropriate level of analysis:  All potential effects
label: BODY

text: resulting from the proposed increase in activities are minor; therefore, an EIS is not required.  In addition,
label: BODY

text: the source would be applying the Best Available Control Technology and the analysis indicates
label: BODY

text: compliance with all applicable air quality rules and regulations.
label: BODY
